name: Ortus Regni
description: Ortus Regni is a new and novel card game inspired by the late Anglo-Saxon period of English history. The Late Anglo-Saxon era in English history is a time of warring Earls. Minor kings all, they claim whatever lands they can. All the while, the Vikings roam not just the sea, but the land.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2+ Processor: SSE2 instruction set support. Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: SM2; generally everything made since 2004 should work. DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 700 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Fun card game that is free, as far as I can tell.   The interface and tutorial could be better, as it took a while to learn what was going on, but a  solid game otherwise.  You can right click cards to read what they do. I don't believe the game tells you this though.  Neat game otherwise though.

Just played through the training/tutorial, then played a quick 4-way match versus AI, so here's a quickie. Interesting game to say the least! Build a custom deck, or go with a pre-made one (Land and Army heavy, Intrigue, etc.), and defeat your opponents to claim the Throne (er, table)! For free-fiddy-free, you can't really go wrong giving this a shot, especially if you dig medieval games, card games, or strategy. I'd recommend giving it a go. I'd safely say this game won't be for everyone (which one is?) but, hell, it's FREE to play/try :)

You know what would be awesome? A card game where none of the cards tell you what they do! Said no one. Ever.

Definitely complicated, but it's nothing a tutorial and a few practice games can't fix. The Politics is a fun feature, although it's frustrating that it's completely reliant on whether or not you have the right cards. It's practically dumb luck. Definitely worth a download, and it's great with a couple friends. But, the cards are lame-looking, and could use a re-design. Definitely one I'll keep playing onward.
